author: Bahá'u'lláh
source_text: ِكَ وَوَاحِدٌ فِي أَمْرِكَ وَواحِدٌ فِي ظُهُورِكَ طُوبى لِمَنِ انْقَطَعَ فِي حُبِّكَ عَنْ سَوائِكَ وَسَرُعَ إِلى أُفُقِ ظُهُورِكَ وَفَازَ بِهذِهِ الكَأْسِ الَّتِيْ جَعَلَتِ البُحُورَ كُلَّها دُونَ مَقامِها، أَسْئَلُكَ يا إِلهِي بِقُوَّتِكَ وَقُدْرَتِكَ وَسُلْطانِكَ الَّذِيْ أَحاطَ مَنْ فِي سَمآئِكَ وَأَرْضِكَ بِأَنْ تُعَرِّفَ العِبادَ هذا السَّبِيلَ المُبِينَ وَهذا الصِّراطَ المُسْتَقِيمَ ليَعْتَرِفُوا بِوَحْدانِيَّتِكَ وَف
translation: And since it hath been demonstrated that Thy most august Self is immeasurably exalted above all that hath been created in the world of being, and is far above the reach and ken of the apprehension of Thy chosen Ones and Thy loved Ones, the splendors of the light of Thy unity are therefore manifested, and it becometh evident unto every one, whether free or bond, that Thou art One in Thine own Self, one in Thy Cause, and one in Thy Revelation. Great is the blessedness of the man who, in his love towards Thee, hath rid himself of all attachment from every one except Thyself, and hastened unto the horizon of Thy Revelation, and attained unto this Cup which Thou hast caused to excel all the seas of the earth.

alignment.en: all attachment from every one except Thyself

terms.literal: manifestation; appearance; to appear; to manifest
terms.note: Root z-h-r typically 'Manifestation' or 'manifestation' (96 occ). SE renders as 'Revelation' here, aligning with theological language of divine self-disclosure rather than ontological appearance.

cross_refs.snippet: daysprings of authority and sources of command

terms.literal: to be severed; to be cut off; to detach oneself; to abstain
terms.note: Root q-t-ʿ typically renders as 'detached' or 'sundered' (33 occ). Here 'hath rid himself' emphasizes active moral choice and psychological liberation rather than passive severance.
Root ḥ-b-b typically 'loved ones' or 'beloved' (92 occ). Here 'love towards Thee' nominalized as abstract virtue; SE preserves genitive relationship ('love of Thee') over predicate forms.

cross_refs.snippet: beloved of the one true God

terms.note: Root k-w-s consistently 'Cup' or 'Chalice' (5 occ). SE maintains singular metaphorical vessel; capitalization signals theological significance matching Qur'anic covenant imagery.
Root ʾ-h-t typically 'encompassed' or 'enveloped' (4 occ). Here 'hath encompassed' preserves perfect aspect; emphasizes God's eternal sovereignty over creation rather than temporal enclosure.
